00051 /* find out on which operating system we are running */
00052 
00053 #if defined( VAX ) || defined( __VMS )
00054 #define OS_VMS
00055 #endif
00056 
00057 #if defined( _MSC_VER )
00058 #define OS_WINNT
00059 #endif
00060 
00061 #if defined( __MSDOS__ )
00062 #define OS_MSDOS
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 #if defined ( vxw )
00066 #define OS_VXWORKS
00067 #undef OS_UNIX
00068 #endif
00069 
00070 #if !defined(OS_LINUX)
00071 #if defined ( __linux__ )
00072 #define OS_LINUX
00073 #endif
00074 #endif
00075 
00076 #if defined(OS_LINUX) || defined(OS_OSF1) || defined(OS_ULTRIX) || defined(OS_FREEBSD) || defined(OS_SOLARIS) || defined(OS_IRIX) || defined(OS_DARWIN)
00077 #define OS_UNIX
00078 #endif
00079 
00080 #if !defined(OS_IRIX) && !defined(OS_VMS) && !defined(OS_MSDOS) && !defined(OS_UNIX) && !defined(OS_VXWORKS) && !defined(OS_WINNT)
00081 #error MIDAS cannot be used on this operating system
00082 #endif

00097 typedef unsigned char BYTE;
00098 typedef unsigned short int WORD;

00111 /*
00112   Definitions depending on integer types:
00113 
00114   Note that the alpha chip uses 32 bit integers by default.
00115   Therefore always use 'INT' instead 'int'.
00116 */
00117 #if defined(OS_MSDOS)
00118 typedef long int INT;
00119 #elif defined( OS_WINNT )
00120 
00121 /* INT predefined in windows.h */
00122 #ifndef _INC_WINDOWS
00123 #include <windows.h>
00124 #endif
00125 
00126 #undef DB_TRUNCATED 
00127 
00128 #else
00129 typedef int INT;
00130 #endif
00131 
00132 typedef INT HNDLE;
00133 
00134 /* Include vxWorks for BOOL definition */
00135 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
00136 #ifndef __INCvxWorksh
00137 #include <vxWorks.h>
00138 #endif
00139 #endif
00140 
00141 /*
00142    Conversion from pointer to interger and back.
00143 
00144    On 64-bit systems, pointers are long ints
00145    On 32-bit systems, pointers are int
00146 
00147    Never use direct casting, since the code might then
00148    not be portable between 32-bit and 64-bit systems
00149 
00150 */
00151 #if defined(__alpha) || defined(_LP64)
00152 #define POINTER_T     long int
00153 #else
00154 #define POINTER_T     int
00155 #endif
00156 
00157 /* define old PTYPE for compatibility with old code */
00158 #define PTYPE POINTER_T
00159

00161 #if defined(OS_WINNT)
00162 typedef HANDLE midas_thread_t;
00163 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
00164 #include <pthread.h>
00165 typedef pthread_t midas_thread_t;
00166 #else
00167 typedef INT midas_thread_t;
00168 #endif

00272 /**
00273 Data format */
00274 #define FORMAT_MIDAS  1       /**< MIDAS banks                        */
00275 #define FORMAT_YBOS   2       /**< YBOS  banks                        */
00276 #define FORMAT_ASCII  3       /**< ASCII format                       */
00277 #define FORMAT_FIXED  4       /**< Fixed length binary records        */
00278 #define FORMAT_DUMP   5       /**< Dump (detailed ASCII) format       */
00279 #define FORMAT_HBOOK  6       /**< CERN hbook (rz) format             */
00280 #define FORMAT_ROOT   7       /**< CERN ROOT format                   */

00282 /**
00283 Event Sampling type */
00284 #define GET_ALL   (1<<0)      /**< get all events (consume)           */
00285 #define GET_NONBLOCKING (1<<1)/**< get as much as possible without blocking producer */
00286 #define GET_RECENT (1<<2)     /**< get recent event (not older than 1 s)*/
00287 
00288 /**
00289 Data types Definition                         min      max    */
00290 #define TID_BYTE      1       /**< unsigned byte         0       255    */
00291 #define TID_SBYTE     2       /**< signed byte         -128      127    */
00292 #define TID_CHAR      3       /**< single character      0       255    */
00293 #define TID_WORD      4       /**< two bytes             0      65535   */
00294 #define TID_SHORT     5       /**< signed word        -32768    32767   */
00295 #define TID_DWORD     6       /**< four bytes            0      2^32-1  */
00296 #define TID_INT       7       /**< signed dword        -2^31    2^31-1  */
00297 #define TID_BOOL      8       /**< four bytes bool       0        1     */
00298 #define TID_FLOAT     9       /**< 4 Byte float format                  */
00299 #define TID_DOUBLE   10       /**< 8 Byte float format                  */
00300 #define TID_BITFIELD 11       /**< 32 Bits Bitfield      0  111... (32) */
00301 #define TID_STRING   12       /**< zero terminated string               */
00302 #define TID_ARRAY    13       /**< array with unknown contents          */
00303 #define TID_STRUCT   14       /**< structure with fixed length          */
00304 #define TID_KEY      15       /**< key in online database               */
00305 #define TID_LINK     16       /**< link in online database              */
00306 #define TID_LAST     17       /**< end of TID list indicator            */
00307

00312 #define DETACH        2

00345 /**
00346 Transitions values */
00347 #define TR_START      (1<<0)  /**< Start transition  */
00348 #define TR_STOP       (1<<1)  /**< Stop transition  */
00349 #define TR_PAUSE      (1<<2)  /**< Pause transition */
00350 #define TR_RESUME     (1<<3)  /**< Resume transition  */
00351 #define TR_STARTABORT (1<<4)  /**< Start aborted transition  */
00352 #define TR_DEFERRED   (1<<12)
00353 
00354 /** 
00355 Equipment types */
00356 #define EQ_PERIODIC    (1<<0)   /**< Periodic Event */
00357 #define EQ_POLLED      (1<<1)   /**< Polling Event */
00358 #define EQ_INTERRUPT   (1<<2)   /**< Interrupt Event */
00359 #define EQ_MULTITHREAD (1<<3)   /**< Multithread Event readout */
00360 #define EQ_SLOW        (1<<4)   /**< Slow Control Event */
00361 #define EQ_MANUAL_TRIG (1<<5)   /**< Manual triggered Event */
00362 #define EQ_FRAGMENTED  (1<<6)   /**< Fragmented Event */
00363 #define EQ_EB          (1<<7)   /**< Event run through the event builder */
00364 
00365 
00366 /** 
00367 Read - On flags */
00368 #define RO_RUNNING    (1<<0)   /**< While running */
00369 #define RO_STOPPED    (1<<1)   /**< Before stopping the run */
00370 #define RO_PAUSED     (1<<2)   /**< ??? */
00371 #define RO_BOR        (1<<3)   /**< At the Begin of run */
00372 #define RO_EOR        (1<<4)   /**< At the End of run */
00373 #define RO_PAUSE      (1<<5)   /**< Before pausing the run */
00374 #define RO_RESUME     (1<<6)   /**< Before resuming the run */
00375 
00376 #define RO_TRANSITIONS (RO_BOR|RO_EOR|RO_PAUSE|RO_RESUME)      /**< At all transitions */
00377 #define RO_ALWAYS      (0xFF)      /**<  Always (independent of the run status) */
00378 
00379 #define RO_ODB        (1<<8)   /**< Submit data to ODB only */

00403 /* event sources in equipment */
00404 /**
00405 Code the LAM crate and LAM station into a bitwise register.
00406 @param c Crate number
00407 @param s Slot number
00408 */
00409 #define LAM_SOURCE(c, s)         (c<<24 | ((s) & 0xFFFFFF))
00410 
00411 /** 
00412 Code the Station number bitwise for the LAM source.
00413 @param s Slot number
00414 */
00415 #define LAM_STATION(s)           (1<<(s-1))
00416 
00417 /** 
00418 Convert the coded LAM crate to Crate number.
00419 @param c coded crate
00420 */
00421 #define LAM_SOURCE_CRATE(c)      (c>>24)
00422 
00423 /** 
00424 Convert the coded LAM station to Station number.
00425 @param s Slot number
00426 */
00427 #define LAM_SOURCE_STATION(s)    ((s) & 0xFFFFFF)
00428 
00429 /**
00430 CNAF commands */
00431 #define CNAF        0x1         /* normal read/write                */
00432 #define CNAF_nQ     0x2         /* Repeat read until noQ            */
00433 
00434 #define CNAF_INHIBIT_SET         0x100
00435 #define CNAF_INHIBIT_CLEAR       0x101
00436 #define CNAF_CRATE_CLEAR         0x102
00437 #define CNAF_CRATE_ZINIT         0x103
00438 #define CNAF_TEST                0x110

00446 /**
00447 MAX */
00448 #ifndef MAX
00449 #define MAX(a,b)            (((a) > (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00450 #endif
00451 
00452 /**
00453 MIN */
00454 #ifndef MIN
00455 #define MIN(a,b)            (((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b))
00456 #endif

00464 /**
00465 Align macro for variable data alignment */

00620 #define SS_END_OF_TAPE              422   /**< - */
00621 #define SS_END_OF_FILE              423   /**< - */
00622 #define SS_FILE_EXISTS              424   /**< - */
00623 #define SS_NO_SPACE                 425   /**< - */
00624 #define SS_INVALID_FORMAT           426   /**< - */
00625 #define SS_NO_ROOT                  427   /**< - */
00626 #define SS_SIZE_MISMATCH            428   /**< - */
00627 #define SS_NO_MUTEX                 429   /**< - */

00686 /** 
00687 Alarm error code */
00688 #define AL_SUCCESS                    1   /**< - */
00689 #define AL_INVALID_NAME            1002   /**< - */
00690 #define AL_ERROR_ODB               1003   /**< - */
00691 #define AL_RESET                   1004   /**< - */
00692 
00693 /** 
00694 Slow control device driver commands */
00695 #define CMD_INIT                      1 /* misc. commands must be below 20 !! */
00696 #define CMD_EXIT                      2
00697 #define CMD_START                     3
00698 #define CMD_STOP                      4
00699 #define CMD_IDLE                      5
00700 #define CMD_GET_THRESHOLD             6
00701 #define CMD_GET_THRESHOLD_CURRENT     7
00702 #define CMD_GET_THRESHOLD_ZERO        8
00703 #define CMD_SET_LABEL                 9
00704 #define CMD_GET_LABEL                10
00705 #define CMD_OPEN                     11
00706 #define CMD_CLOSE                    12
00707 #define CMD_MISC_LAST                12 /* update this if you add new commands */
00708 
00709 #define CMD_SET_FIRST                CMD_MISC_LAST+1 /* set commands */
00710 #define CMD_SET                      CMD_SET_FIRST   // = 13
00711 #define CMD_SET_VOLTAGE_LIMIT        CMD_SET_FIRST+1
00712 #define CMD_SET_CURRENT_LIMIT        CMD_SET_FIRST+2
00713 #define CMD_SET_RAMPUP               CMD_SET_FIRST+3
00714 #define CMD_SET_RAMPDOWN             CMD_SET_FIRST+4
00715 #define CMD_SET_TRIP_TIME            CMD_SET_FIRST+5
00716 #define CMD_SET_LAST                 CMD_SET_FIRST+5 /* update this if you add new commands */
00717 
00718 #define CMD_GET_FIRST                CMD_SET_LAST+1  /* multithreaded get commands */
00719 #define CMD_GET                      CMD_GET_FIRST   // = 19
00720 #define CMD_GET_CURRENT              CMD_GET_FIRST+1
00721 #define CMD_GET_TRIP                 CMD_GET_FIRST+2
00722 #define CMD_GET_LAST                 CMD_GET_FIRST+2 /* update this if you add new commands ! */
00723 
00724 #define CMD_GET_DIRECT               CMD_GET_LAST+1  /* direct get commands */
00725 #define CMD_GET_DEMAND               CMD_GET_DIRECT  // = 22
00726 #define CMD_GET_VOLTAGE_LIMIT        CMD_GET_DIRECT+1
00727 #define CMD_GET_CURRENT_LIMIT        CMD_GET_DIRECT+2
00728 #define CMD_GET_RAMPUP               CMD_GET_DIRECT+3
00729 #define CMD_GET_RAMPDOWN             CMD_GET_DIRECT+4
00730 #define CMD_GET_TRIP_TIME            CMD_GET_DIRECT+5 
00731 #define CMD_GET_DIRECT_LAST          CMD_GET_DIRECT+5 /* update this if you add new commands ! */
00732 
00733 #define CMD_ENABLE_COMMAND       (1<<14)  /* these two commands can be used to enable/disable */
00734 #define CMD_DISABLE_COMMAND      (1<<15)  /* one of the other commands                        */
00735 
00736 /** 
00737 Slow control bus driver commands */
00738 #define CMD_WRITE                   100
00739 #define CMD_READ                    101
00740 #define CMD_PUTS                    102
00741 #define CMD_GETS                    103
00742 #define CMD_DEBUG                   104
00743 #define CMD_NAME                    105
00744 
00745 /** 
00746 Commands for interrupt events */
00747 #define CMD_INTERRUPT_ENABLE        100
00748 #define CMD_INTERRUPT_DISABLE       101
00749 #define CMD_INTERRUPT_ATTACH        102
00750 #define CMD_INTERRUPT_DETACH        103
00751 
00752 /**
00753 macros for bus driver access */
00754 #define BD_GETS(s,z,p,t)   info->bd(CMD_GETS, info->bd_info, s, z, p, t)
00755 #define BD_READS(s,z,p,t)  info->bd(CMD_READ, info->bd_info, s, z, p, t)
00756 #define BD_PUTS(s)         info->bd(CMD_PUTS, info->bd_info, s)
00757 #define BD_WRITES(s)       info->bd(CMD_WRITE, info->bd_info, s)
00758 
00759 /**dox***************************************************************/
00760           /** @} *//* end of 26 */

00763           /** @} *//* end of mdeferrorh */

00770 /*---- Buffer manager structures -----------------------------------*/
00771 
00772 /**dox***************************************************************/
00773 /** @addtogroup msectionh
00774  *  
00775  *  @{  */
00776 
00777 /**dox***************************************************************/
00778 /** @defgroup mbufferh Buffer Section
00779  *  @{  */
00780 /**
00781 Event header */
00782 typedef struct {
00783    short int event_id;           /**< event ID starting from one      */
00784    short int trigger_mask;       /**< hardware trigger mask           */
00785    DWORD serial_number;          /**< serial number starting from one */
00786    DWORD time_stamp;             /**< time of production of event     */
00787    DWORD data_size;              /**< size of event in bytes w/o header */
00788 } EVENT_HEADER;
00789 
00790 /**
00791 TRIGGER_MASK
00792 Extract or set the trigger mask field pointed by the argument.
00793 @param e pointer to the midas event (pevent)
00794 */
00795 #define TRIGGER_MASK(e)    ((((EVENT_HEADER *) e)-1)->trigger_mask)
00796 
00797 /**
00798 EVENT_ID
00799 Extract or set the event ID field pointed by the argument..
00800 @param e pointer to the midas event (pevent)
00801 */
00802 #define EVENT_ID(e)        ((((EVENT_HEADER *) e)-1)->event_id)
00803 
00804 /**
00805 SERIAL_NUMBER
00806 Extract or set/reset the serial number field pointed by the argument.
00807 @param e pointer to the midas event (pevent)
00808 */
00809 #define SERIAL_NUMBER(e)   ((((EVENT_HEADER *) e)-1)->serial_number)
00810 
00811 /**
00812 TIME_STAMP
00813 Extract or set/reset the time stamp field pointed by the argument.
00814 @param e pointer to the midas event (pevent)
00815 */
00816 #define TIME_STAMP(e)      ((((EVENT_HEADER *) e)-1)->time_stamp)
00817 
00818 /**
00819 DATA_SIZE
00820 Extract or set/reset the data size field pointed by the argument.
00821 @param e pointer to the midas event (pevent)
00822 */
00823 #define DATA_SIZE(e)      ((((EVENT_HEADER *) e)-1)->data_size)
00824 
00825 #define EVENT_SOURCE(e,o)  (* (INT*) (e+o))
00826 
00827 /**
00828 system event IDs */
00829 #define EVENTID_BOR      ((short int) 0x8000)  /**< Begin-of-run      */
00830 #define EVENTID_EOR      ((short int) 0x8001)  /**< End-of-run        */
00831 #define EVENTID_MESSAGE  ((short int) 0x8002)  /**< Message events    */
00832 
00833 /**
00834 fragmented events */
00835 #define EVENTID_FRAG1    ((unsigned short) 0xC000)      /* first fragment */
00836 #define EVENTID_FRAG     ((unsigned short) 0xD000)      /* added to real event-id */
00837 
00838 /**
00839 magic number used in trigger_mask for BOR event */
00840 #define MIDAS_MAGIC      0x494d            /**< 'MI' */
00841 
00842 
00843 /**
00844 Buffer structure */
00845 typedef struct {
00846    INT id;                       /**< request id                      */
00847    BOOL valid;                   /**< indicating a valid entry        */
00848    short int event_id;           /**< event ID                        */
00849    short int trigger_mask;       /**< trigger mask                    */
00850    INT sampling_type;            /**< GET_ALL, GET_NONBLOCKING, GET_RECENT */
00851 } EVENT_REQUEST;
00852 
00853 typedef struct {
00854    char name[NAME_LENGTH];            /**< name of client             */
00855    INT pid;                           /**< process ID                 */
00856    INT unused0;                       /**< was thread ID              */
00857    INT unused;                        /**< was thread handle          */
00858    INT port;                          /**< UDP port for wake up       */
00859    INT read_pointer;                  /**< read pointer to buffer     */
00860    INT max_request_index;             /**< index of last request      */
00861    INT num_received_events;           /**< no of received events      */
00862    INT num_sent_events;               /**< no of sent events          */
00863    INT num_waiting_events;            /**< no of waiting events       */
00864    float data_rate;                   /**< data rate in kB/sec        */
00865    BOOL read_wait;                    /**< wait for read - flag       */
00866    INT write_wait;                    /**< wait for write # bytes     */
00867    BOOL wake_up;                      /**< client got a wake-up msg   */
00868    BOOL all_flag;                     /**< at least one GET_ALL request */
00869    DWORD last_activity;               /**< time of last activity      */
00870    DWORD watchdog_timeout;            /**< timeout in ms              */
00871 
00872    EVENT_REQUEST event_request[MAX_EVENT_REQUESTS];
00873 
00874 } BUFFER_CLIENT;
00875 
00876 typedef struct {
00877    char name[NAME_LENGTH];            /**< name of buffer             */
00878    INT num_clients;                   /**< no of active clients       */
00879    INT max_client_index;              /**< index of last client       */
00880    INT size;                          /**< size of data area in bytes */
00881    INT read_pointer;                  /**< read pointer               */
00882    INT write_pointer;                 /**< write pointer              */
00883    INT num_in_events;                 /**< no of received events      */
00884    INT num_out_events;                /**< no of distributed events   */
00885 
00886    BUFFER_CLIENT client[MAX_CLIENTS]; /**< entries for clients        */
00887 
00888 } BUFFER_HEADER;
00889 
00890 /* Per-process buffer access structure (descriptor) */
00891 
00892 typedef struct {
00893    BOOL attached;                   /**< TRUE if buffer is attached   */
00894    INT client_index;                /**< index to CLIENT str. in buf. */
00895    BUFFER_HEADER *buffer_header;    /**< pointer to buffer header     */
00896    void *buffer_data;               /**< pointer to buffer data       */
00897    char *read_cache;                /**< cache for burst read         */
00898    INT read_cache_size;             /**< cache size in bytes          */
00899    INT read_cache_rp;               /**< cache read pointer           */
00900    INT read_cache_wp;               /**< cache write pointer          */
00901    char *write_cache;               /**< cache for burst read         */
00902    INT write_cache_size;            /**< cache size in bytes          */
00903    INT write_cache_rp;              /**< cache read pointer           */
00904    INT write_cache_wp;              /**< cache write pointer          */
00905    HNDLE semaphore;                 /**< semaphore handle             */
00906    INT shm_handle;                  /**< handle to shared memory      */
00907    INT index;                       /**< connection index / tid       */
00908    BOOL callback;                   /**< callback defined for this buffer */
00909 
00910 } BUFFER;
00911 
00912 typedef struct {
00913    DWORD type;                        /**< TID_xxx type                      */
00914    INT num_values;                    /**< number of values                  */
00915    char name[NAME_LENGTH];            /**< name of variable                  */
00916    INT data;                          /**< Address of variable (offset)      */
00917    INT total_size;                    /**< Total size of data block          */
00918    INT item_size;                     /**< Size of single data item          */
00919    WORD access_mode;                  /**< Access mode                       */
00920    WORD notify_count;                 /**< Notify counter                    */
00921    INT next_key;                      /**< Address of next key               */
00922    INT parent_keylist;                /**< keylist to which this key belongs */
00923    INT last_written;                  /**< Time of last write action  */
00924 } KEY;
00925 
00926 typedef struct {
00927    INT parent;                        /**< Address of parent key      */
00928    INT num_keys;                      /**< number of keys             */
00929    INT first_key;                     /**< Address of first key       */
00930 } KEYLIST;

00937 /**dox***************************************************************/

00939  *  @{  */
00940 
00941 #define DF_INPUT       (1<<0)         /**< channel is input           */
00942 #define DF_OUTPUT      (1<<1)         /**< channel is output          */
00943 #define DF_PRIO_DEVICE (1<<2)         /**< get demand values from device instead of ODB */
00944 #define DF_READ_ONLY   (1<<3)         /**< never write demand values to device */
00945 #define DF_MULTITHREAD (1<<4)         //*< access device with a dedicated thread */
00946 #define DF_HW_RAMP     (1<<5)         //*< high voltage device can do hardware ramping */
00947

00964 
00965 } DD_MT_BUFFER;
00966 
00967 typedef struct {
00968    WORD event_id;                     /**< Event ID associated with equipm.  */
00969    WORD trigger_mask;                 /**< Trigger mask                      */
00970    char buffer[NAME_LENGTH];          /**< Event buffer to send events into  */
00971    INT eq_type;                       /**< One of EQ_xxx                     */
00972    INT source;                        /**< Event source (LAM/IRQ)            */
00973    char format[8];                    /**< Data format to produce            */
00974    BOOL enabled;                      /**< Enable flag                       */
00975    INT read_on;                       /**< Combination of Read-On flags RO_xxx */
00976    INT period;                        /**< Readout interval/Polling time in ms */
00977    double event_limit;                /**< Stop run when limit is reached    */
00978    DWORD num_subevents;               /**< Number of events in super event */
00979    INT history;                       /**< Log history                       */
00980    char frontend_host[NAME_LENGTH];   /**< Host on which FE is running       */
00981    char frontend_name[NAME_LENGTH];   /**< Frontend name                     */
00982    char frontend_file_name[256];      /**< Source file used for user FE      */
00983    char status[256];                  /**< Current status of equipment       */
00984    char status_color[NAME_LENGTH];    /**< Color to be used by mhttpd for status */
00985 } EQUIPMENT_INFO;
00986 
00987 typedef struct {
00988    char name[NAME_LENGTH];            /**< Driver name                       */

00990    INT channels;                      /**< Number of channels                */
00991    INT(*bd) (INT cmd, ...);           /**< Bus driver entry point            */
00992    DWORD flags;                       /**< Combination of DF_xx              */
00993    void *dd_info;                     /**< Private info for device driver    */
00994    DD_MT_BUFFER *mt_buffer;           /**< pointer to multithread buffer     */
00995    INT stop_thread;                   /**< flag used to stop the thread      */
00996    MUTEX_T *mutex;                    /**< mutex for buffer                  */
00997    INT semaphore;                     /**< semaphore for device access       */
00998    EQUIPMENT_INFO *pequipment;        /**< pointer to equipment              */
00999 } DEVICE_DRIVER;

01156 
01157 #define ANA_OUTPUT_INFO_STR "\
01158 Filename = STRING : [256] run%05d.asc\n\
01159 RWNT = BOOL : 0\n\
01160 Histo Dump = BOOL : 0\n\
01161 Histo Dump Filename = STRING : [256] his%05d.rz\n\
01162 Clear histos = BOOL : 1\n\
01163 Last Histo Filename = STRING : [256] last.rz\n\
01164 Events to ODB = BOOL : 1\n\
01165 Global Memory Name = STRING : [8] ONLN\n\
01166 "

01168 /*---- Tests -------------------------------------------------------*/
01169 
01170 typedef struct {
01171    char name[80];
01172    BOOL registered;
01173    DWORD count;
01174    DWORD previous_count;
01175    BOOL value;
01176 } ANA_TEST;
01177 
01178 #define SET_TEST(t, v) { if (!t.registered) test_register(&t); t.value = (v); }
01179 #define TEST(t) (t.value)
01180 
01181 #ifdef DEFINE_TESTS
01182 #define DEF_TEST(t) ANA_TEST t = { #t, 0, 0, FALSE };
01183 #else
01184 #define DEF_TEST(t) extern ANA_TEST t;
01185 #endif
01186 /**dox***************************************************************/
01187           /** @} *//* end of manalyzer */

01195 #define RT_DATA (*((DWORD *) "HSDA"))
01196 #define RT_DEF  (*((DWORD *) "HSDF"))
01197 
01198 typedef struct {
01199    DWORD record_type;           /* RT_DATA or RT_DEF */
01200    DWORD event_id;
01201    DWORD time;
01202    DWORD def_offset;            /* place of definition */
01203    DWORD data_size;             /* data following this header in bytes */
01204 } HIST_RECORD;
01205 
01206 typedef struct {
01207    DWORD event_id;
01208    char event_name[NAME_LENGTH];
01209    DWORD def_offset;
01210 } DEF_RECORD;
01211 
01212 typedef struct {
01213    DWORD event_id;
01214    DWORD time;
01215    DWORD offset;
01216 } INDEX_RECORD;
01217

01222    TAG *tag;
01223    DWORD hist_fh;
01224    DWORD index_fh;
01225    DWORD def_fh;
01226    DWORD base_time;

01236  *  @{  */
01237 /** Contains the main parameters regarding the run status.
01238     The containt reflects the current system ONLY if Midas clients
01239     are connected. Otherwise the status is erroneous.
01240 */
01241 typedef struct {
01242    INT state;                         /**< Current run condition  */
01243    INT online_mode;                   /**< Mode of operation online/offline */
01244    INT run_number;                    /**< Current processing run number      */
01245    INT transition_in_progress;        /**< Intermediate state during transition */
01246    INT start_abort;                   /**< Set if run start was aborted */
01247    INT requested_transition;          /**< Deferred transition request */
01248    char start_time[32];               /**< ASCII of the last start time */
01249    DWORD start_time_binary;           /**< Bin of the last start time */
01250    char stop_time[32];                /**< ASCII of the last stop time */
01251    DWORD stop_time_binary;            /**< ASCII of the last stop time */
01252 } RUNINFO;
01253

01255 "[.]",\
01256 "State = INT : 1",\
01257 "Online Mode = INT : 1",\
01258 "Run number = INT : 0",\
01259 "Transition in progress = INT : 0",\
01260 "Start abort = INT : 0",\
01261 "Requested transition = INT : 0",\
01262 "Start time = STRING : [32] Tue Sep 09 15:04:42 1997",\
01263 "Start time binary = DWORD : 0",\
01264 "Stop time = STRING : [32] Tue Sep 09 15:04:42 1997",\
01265 "Stop time binary = DWORD : 0",\
01266 "",\
01267 NULL }

01955    /* root functions really are C++ functions */ extern TFolder *gManaHistosFolder;
01956 extern TObjArray *gHistoFolderStack;
01957 
01958    // book functions put a root object in a suitable folder
01959    // for histos, there are a lot of types, so we use templates.
01960    // for other objects we have one function per object
01961 template < typename TH1X >
01962     TH1X EXPRT * h1_book(const char *name, const char *title,
01963                          int bins, double min, double max)
01964 {
01965    TH1X *hist;
01966 
01967    /* check if histo already exists */
01968    if (!gHistoFolderStack->Last())
01969       hist = (TH1X *) gManaHistosFolder->FindObjectAny(name);
01970    else
01971       hist = (TH1X *) ((TFolder *) gHistoFolderStack->Last())->FindObjectAny(name);
01972 
01973    if (hist == NULL) {
01974       hist = new TH1X(name, title, bins, min, max);
01975       if (!gHistoFolderStack->Last())
01976          gManaHistosFolder->Add(hist);
01977       else
01978          ((TFolder *) gHistoFolderStack->Last())->Add(hist);
01979    }
01980 
01981    return hist;
01982 }
01983 
01984 template < typename TH1X >
01985     TH1X EXPRT * h1_book(const char *name, const char *title, int bins, double edges[])
01986 {
01987    TH1X *hist;
01988 
01989    /* check if histo already exists */
01990    if (!gHistoFolderStack->Last())
01991       hist = (TH1X *) gManaHistosFolder->FindObjectAny(name);
01992    else
01993       hist = (TH1X *) ((TFolder *) gHistoFolderStack->Last())->FindObjectAny(name);
01994 
01995    if (hist == NULL) {
01996       hist = new TH1X(name, title, bins, edges);
01997       if (!gHistoFolderStack->Last())
01998          gManaHistosFolder->Add(hist);
01999       else
02000          ((TFolder *) gHistoFolderStack->Last())->Add(hist);
02001    }
02002 
02003    return hist;
02004 }

02099    /*
02100     * the following two macros allow for simple fortran like usage
02101     * for the most common histo types
02102     */
02103 #define H1_BOOK(n,t,b,min,max) (h1_book<TH1F>(n,t,b,min,max))
02104 #define H2_BOOK(n,t,xb,xmin,xmax,yb,ymin,ymax) (h2_book<TH2F>(n,t,xb,xmin,xmax,yb,ymin,ymax))
